data.title: Public service endures as a Kennedy family tradition
data.meta_description: The following is a list of relatives of John F. Kennedy who worked or are working now in public service positions since the president’s assassination: Robert F. Kennedy (brother, 1925-1968), served a…
data.text:
The following is a list of relatives of John F. Kennedy who worked or are working now in public service positions since the president’s assassination: Robert F. Kennedy (brother, 1925-1968), served as...

The following is a list of relatives of John F. Kennedy who worked or are working now in public service positions since the president’s assassination:

Robert F. Kennedy (brother, 1925-1968), served as U.S. attorney general (1961-1964) in President Kennedy’s administration. Elected to the U.S. Senate from New York in 1964 and served until his assassination in 1968 as a presidential candidate.

Edward M. “Ted” Kennedy (brother, 1932-2009), served in the U.S. Senate from Massachusetts from 1962 to 2009, the year he died. Strong advocate for national health care.

Eunice Kennedy Shriver (sister, 1921-2009), helped found the Special Olympics in 1968.

Jean Kennedy Smith, (sister, born 1928). Served as U.S. ambassador to Ireland (1993-1998).

Caroline Kennedy Schlossberg (daughter, born 1957) a lawyer who helped found the Profile in Courage Award, an annual award presented by the John F. Kennedy Foundation honoring those who have stood for principles for the common good. Now serving as U.S. ambassador to Japan.

Patrick J. Kennedy, (nephew, born 1967), former U.S. representative from Rhode Island; also served in the Rhode Island General Assembly. Son of Ted and Joan Kennedy.

Joseph Kennedy II, (nephew, born 1952), former U.S. representative from Massachusetts who now runs the nonprofit Citizens Energy Corp., in Boston. Son of Robert and Ethel Kennedy.

Robert F. Kennedy Jr., (nephew, born 1954), an environmental lawyer and law professor at Pace University School of Law. Son of Robert and Ethel Kennedy.

Mary Kerry Kennedy, (niece, born 1959), human-rights activist with the Robert F. Kennedy Center for Justice and Human Rights. Daughter of Robert and Ethel Kennedy.

Kathleen Kennedy Townsend, (niece, born 1951), former lieutenant governor of Maryland, ran unsuccessfully for governor. Oldest child of Robert and Ethel Kennedy.

Robert Shriver III, (nephew, born 1954), a lawyer who served on the City Council in Santa Monica, Calif. Son of Eunice Kennedy and Robert Sargent Shriver Jr.

Mark Kennedy Shriver, (nephew, born 1964), executive for Save the Children, a worldwide charity organization.

Anthony Kennedy Shriver, (nephew, born 1965), a mental-health advocate who also founded the global volunteer movement Best Buddies International. Son of Eunice Kennedy and Robert Sargent Shriver Jr.

:
